alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MCINTOSH... NORTHWESTERN PITTSBURG...SOUTH CENTRAL OKMULGEE AND SOUTHEASTERN OKFUSKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM CDT... At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Weleetka to 2 miles south of Dustin. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Henryetta... Weleetka... Indianola... Hanna... Raiford... Pharoah... Bryant... Vernon... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 231 and 233. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
